verses.text: Comfort ye, comfort ye my people , saith your God.

Speak ye comfortably to Jerusalem , and cry unto her, that her warfare is accomplished , that her iniquity is pardoned : for she hath received of the \nd \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hand double for all her sins.\f + \fr 40.2 \ft comfortably: Heb. to the heart\f*\f + \fr 40.2 \ft warfare: or, appointed time\f* \p
¶ The voice of him that crieth in the wilderness , Prepare ye the way of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, make straight in the desert a highway for our God.

Every valley shall be exalted , and every mountain and hill shall be made low : and the crooked shall be made straight , and the rough places plain :\f + \fr 40.4 \ft straight: or, a straight place\f*\f + \fr 40.4 \ft plain: or, a plain place\f*

And the glory of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* shall be revealed , and all flesh shall see \add it\add* together : for the mouth of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath spoken \add it\add*.
The voice said , Cry. And he said , What shall I cry ? All flesh \add is\add* grass , and all the goodliness thereof \add is\add* as the flower of the field :
The grass withereth , the flower fadeth : because the spirit of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* bloweth upon it: surely the people \add is\add* grass.
The grass withereth , the flower fadeth : but the word of our God shall stand for ever. \p

¶ O Zion , that bringest good tidings , get thee up into the high mountain ; O Jerusalem , that bringest good tidings , lift up thy voice with strength ; lift \add it\add* up , be not afraid ; say unto the cities of Judah , Behold your God !\f + \fr 40.9 \ft O Zion…: or, O thou that tellest good tidings to Zion\f*\f + \fr 40.9 \ft O Jerusalem…: or, O thou that tellest good tidings to Jerusalem\f*

Behold, the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd* will come with strong \add hand\add*, and his arm shall rule for him: behold, his reward \add is\add* with him, and his work before him.\f + \fr 40.10 \ft with strong…: or, against the strong\f*\f + \fr 40.10 \ft his work: or, recompence for his work\f*

He shall feed his flock like a shepherd : he shall gather the lambs with his arm , and carry \add them\add* in his bosom , \add and\add* shall gently lead those that are with young.\f + \fr 40.11 \ft that…: or, that give suck\f* \p

¶ Who hath measured the waters in the hollow of his hand , and meted out heaven with the span , and comprehended the dust of the earth in a measure , and weighed the mountains in scales , and the hills in a balance ?\f + \fr 40.12 \ft a measure: Heb. a tierce\f*
Who hath directed the Spirit of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, or \add being\add* his counsellor hath taught him?\f + \fr 40.13 \ft his…: Heb. man of his counsel\f*

With whom took he counsel , and \add who\add* instructed him, and taught him in the path of judgment , and taught him knowledge , and shewed to him the way of understanding ?\f + \fr 40.14 \ft instructed…: Heb. made him understand\f*\f + \fr 40.14 \ft understanding: Heb. understandings?\f*
Behold, the nations \add are\add* as a drop of a bucket , and are counted as the small dust of the balance : behold, he taketh up the isles as a very little thing.
And Lebanon \add is\add* not sufficient to burn , nor the beasts thereof sufficient for a burnt offering.
All nations before him \add are\add* as nothing; and they are counted to him less than nothing , and vanity. \p
¶ To whom then will ye liken God ? or what likeness will ye compare unto him?
The workman melteth a graven image , and the goldsmith spreadeth it over with gold , and casteth silver chains.

He that \add is\add* so impoverished that he hath no oblation chooseth a tree \add that\add* will not rot ; he seeketh unto him a cunning workman to prepare a graven image , \add that\add* shall not be moved.\f + \fr 40.20 \ft is so…: Heb. is poor of oblation\f*
Have ye not known ? have ye not heard ? hath it not been told you from the beginning ? have ye not understood from the foundations of the earth ?

\add It is\add* he that sitteth upon the circle of the earth , and the inhabitants thereof \add are\add* as grasshoppers ; that stretcheth out the heavens as a curtain , and spreadeth them out as a tent to dwell in :\f + \fr 40.22 \ft It is…: or, Him that\f*
That bringeth the princes to nothing; he maketh the judges of the earth as vanity.

Yea, they shall not be planted ; yea, they shall not be sown : yea, their stock shall not take root in the earth : and he shall also blow upon them, and they shall wither , and the whirlwind shall take them away as stubble.
To whom then will ye liken me, or shall I be equal ? saith the Holy One.

Lift up your eyes on high , and behold who hath created these \add things\add*, that bringeth out their host by number : he calleth them all by names by the greatness of his might , for that \add he is\add* strong in power ; not one faileth. \p
Why sayest thou, O Jacob , and speakest , O Israel , My way is hid from the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and my judgment is passed over from my God ? \p

¶ Hast thou not known ? hast thou not heard , \add that\add* the everlasting God , the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, the Creator of the ends of the earth , fainteth not, neither is weary ? \add there is\add* no searching of his understanding.
He giveth power to the faint ; and to \add them that have\add* no might he increaseth strength.
Even the youths shall faint and be weary , and the young men shall utterly fall :

But they that wait upon the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall renew \add their\add* strength ; they shall mount up with wings as eagles ; they shall run , and not be weary ; \add and\add* they shall walk , and not faint.\f + \fr 40.31 \ft renew: Heb. change\f*
